trans-unit.source: Defines size-related attributes of a cached bitmap image.
A bitmap is scaled based on values that are defined by this class.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref> with empty sizing properties.

The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate0>, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `true`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to zero, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to zero.
When passed to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap>, the input is the same as the output.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref>.

Initializes an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref> that preserves the aspect ratio of the source bitmap and specifies an initial <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight"></xref>.

The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate0>, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `true`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to the value of `pixelHeight`, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to zero.
The height, in pixels, of the resulting bitmap.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref>.
Occurs when pixelHeight is less than zero.

Initializes an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref> that preserves the aspect ratio of the source bitmap and specifies an initial <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation"></xref> to apply.
The resulting bitmap maintains its original aspect ratio and sizing.

The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to the value of `rotation`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `true`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to 0, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to 0.
The initial rotation value to apply.
Only 90 degree increments are supported.
A new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref>.

Initializes an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref> that preserves the aspect ratio of the source bitmap and specifies an initial <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelWidth"></xref>.

The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate0>, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `true`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to zero, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to the value of `pixelWidth`.
The width, in pixels, of the resulting bitmap.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref>.
Occurs when pixelWidth is less than zero.
Initializes an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref> that does not preserve the original bitmap aspect ratio.
The resulting bitmap has an effective size of `pixelHeight` Ã— `pixelWidth`.

The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate0>, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `false`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to the value of `pixelHeight`, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to the value of `pixelWidth`.
The width, in pixels, of the resulting bitmap.
The height, in pixels, of the resulting bitmap.
A new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions"></xref>.
Occurs when pixelHeight is less than zero.
The height, in pixels, of the bitmap image.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> must be greater than zero to be valid.
The height of the bitmap.
The width, in pixels, of the bitmap image.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelWidth%2A> must be greater than zero to be valid.
The width of the bitmap.
Gets a value that determines whether the aspect ratio of the original bitmap image is preserved.

If the original aspect ratio is preserved, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> represent the maximum size values for the bitmap.
The resulting bitmap is only guaranteed to have either its width or its height match the specified values.

If the aspect ratio is not preserved, the specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> are both used, and the bitmap is stretched to use those values.
`true` if the original aspect ratio is maintained; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that represents the rotation angle that is applied to a bitmap.
Only increments of 90 degrees are supported.
The rotation angle that is applied to the image.
